variable.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
Interest rates can be highly variable.
These fish are highly variable in color and pattern.
variable.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The quality of pork is often less variable than beef.
variable.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The heater has variable temperature settings.
variable.translation[1].definitions[0].d: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen
variable.translation[1].definitions[0].e: There are too many variables in the experiment to predict the result accurately.
variable.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a mathematical quantity which can represent several different amounts
variable.translation[2].definitions[0].d: something that affects a situation in a way that means you cannot be sure what will happen
variable.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Interest rates and earnings are the two most important variables in forecasting stock prices.
The Japanese are subject to the sameeconomic variables as everybody else.
variable.translation[3].definitions[0].d: variable costs, prices, interest rates etc change or can change and are not fixed
variable.translation[3].definitions[0].e: The value of fixed- andvariable-rate loans fell half a per cent.
The new company will offer more attractivevariable annuities.
